Frell: We have UN, we don’t need any other police. We just have to take away the veto-right from US and the other criminals/former criminals.

The UN uses a majority of our troops because we are such a large power… Unless we completely withdraw there’s no way to get out of it
[/quote]
Wasn’t the Iraq and Aghanistan wars US’ idea?
And the Libya intervention would pay you back in bloody oil.[/quote]
Wars were still justified but we still managed to go their for a different reason and still fuck up. We basically did everything right, proved the right people guilty, then went in and didn’t do anything that we said we would.

item.title: Calif. pot dispensaries told by feds to shut down
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:26, topic:417310”][quote author=jme link=topic=519863.msg3776192#msg3776192 date=1318116505]
Maybe I had the wrong impression then. Your states/fed sound like our provinces/fed

but how come your states control laws such as muder, … hell u can shoot a trespasser in texas. if muder was a federal crime, then it would actually be illegal to shoot trespassers.

states should control healthcare you say? Then why are feds controlling it, by closing down medicine dispensaries. Feds don’t see marijuana as medicine, but thats irrelevant, because thats a healthcare issue, to be controlled by state.
[/quote]Gun laws are different in every state and trespassing and self defense laws differ in every state.[/quote]

Thats what i dont understand though. shouldn’t the states be controlling drugs?

[quote=“Frell, post:23, topic:417310”]Federal:
International shit
Laws and policies that affect everyone (but don’t interfere with state rights)
Federal crimes
Military
Federal tax for federal shit

State:
Schools
State Universities
Healthcare (should)
Social Security (should)
Voting
Licenses
State tax for shit
infrastructure[/quote]

doesnt seem accurate to me. seems to me your states control laws that effect everyone. and the feds go after terminally ill people just trying to get medicine.

Read full topic

item.title: Calif. pot dispensaries told by feds to shut down
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:8, topic:417310”]I think that the dispensaries in Michigan just went through pretty much the same process… In northern michigan lately they’ve (the police and feds) have busted a huge amount of MM cardholders for growing more then what they were allotted to grow. This really irratates me because I knew from the get-go that the government was going to abuse their regulatory power over cardholders. I think its unfair that they can pick from a giant list of cardholders and raid there houses without any proof that they are exceeding their allotted limit. It recently happened to my uncle and now he’s going to lose his card, have to pay fines, and face possible jail time.

But lo and be hold people who get MIPS get slaps on the wrist and even first time DUI offences aren’t as bad as what they’re doing to people that use pot. I call bullshit on the governments control over our economy and our freedoms in America.[/quote]It’s called the PATRIOT ACT

Oh, and Frell, there shouldn’t be a federally appointed military. The military is strictly for guarding the US, but we police the world, so…

Read full topic

states should control healthcare you say? Then why are feds controlling it, by closing down medicine dispensaries. Feds don’t see marijuana as medicine, but thats irrelevant, because thats a healthcare issue, to be controlled by state.[/quote]Gun laws are different in every state and trespassing and self defense laws differ in every state.

item.source: Calif. pot dispensaries told by feds to shut down

item.title: Calif. pot dispensaries told by feds to shut down
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:21, topic:417310”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=519863.msg3775788#msg3775788 date=1318093373]Btw, Americas legal system is so fucked up haha
[/quote]

no kidding… And just when you think you understand it, it throws a hard ball at you. ie, why can the feds make personal possession laws in the first place?

Law is simple in Canada. All criminal law is federal-wide. We’re ok with that. But Americans shouldn’t be. Excuse my ignorance, but is this not unconstitutional?[/quote]
We have federal crimes here. Its just easier because since we allow the states to control prisons and authority you might aswell allow them to control the rest. Basically if a kid steals CDs from a store the federal courts shouldn’t be bothered.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:22, topic:417310”][quote author=Frell link=topic=519863.msg3776024#msg3776024 date=1318106875]
States aren’t supposed to be independent countries
[/quote]
Why not? If you don’t like what the fed does, say good bye.
I don’t see that any of the states would have any problems as a separate country.[/quote]
Really? So when our country split for the first time that wasn’t enough? States are there because obviously a congressman in washington won’t know enough about Nevada’s local problems to do anything about it.

Look at it this way

Federal:
International shit
Laws and policies that affect everyone (but don’t interfere with state rights)
Federal crimes
Military
Federal tax for federal shit

State:
Schools
State Universities
Healthcare (should)
Social Security (should)
Voting
Licenses
State tax for shit
infrastructure
But they can’t do anything that challenges the fed (the back and forth of this is defined in the constitution)

Basically the fed is supposed to control the big shit and the states are supposed to control domestic issues, because they live within it.

The problem isn’t out legal system, the problem is people pulling the roots from our legal foundation - the Constitution. When you challenge the Constitution this kind of confusion starts, and this is one of the reasons for our debt.

This is why when Americans say “The fed shouldn’t give people welfare checks!” we aren’t ragging on the welfare of the people, we’re getting pissed on the government sucking power from the states.

Im taking government right now and its amazing how far we are from what our founding fathers envisioned.

Read full topic
